description.zh-cn: 中国的执政党，于1921年7月23日成立，在第二次国共内战后取得中国大陆的控制权并于1949年10月1日建立中华人民共和国。
description.en: The ruling political party of China, founded on July 23, 1921. It gained control of mainland China after the Second Chinese Civil War and established the People's Republic of China on October 1, 1949.

description.zh-cn: 一个由苏联共产党主导的国际共产主义组织，旨在推动世界革命。中国共产党早期接受其指挥和援助。
description.en: An international communist organization led by the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, aiming to promote world revolution. The early Communist Party of China accepted its command and aid.

zh-cn: 俄国共产党（布尔什维克）
en: Communist Party of the Soviet Union

description.zh-cn: 苏联的执政党，主导第三国际并对中国共产党的早期发展施加了巨大影响。
description.en: The ruling party of the Soviet Union, which dominated the Comintern and exerted significant influence on the early development of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国的政党，曾在1928年至1949年间统治中国大陆，与中国共产党有过两次合作和两次内战。
description.en: A political party in China that ruled mainland China from 1928 to 1949. It had two periods of cooperation and two civil wars with the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党与中国共产党在1924年至1927年间的首次合作，旨在统一中国并对抗军阀势力。
description.en: The first period of cooperation between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China from 1924 to 1927, aimed at unifying China and combating warlord forces.

description.zh-cn: 由中国国民党主导的中华民国政府，在1949年国共内战失败后迁往台湾。
description.en: The government of the Republic of China led by the Kuomintang, which relocated to Taiwan in 1949 after its defeat in the Chinese Civil War.

description.zh-cn: 1927年由中国共产党领导的针对国民党的武装起义，被认为是中共独立领导武装斗争和创建革命军队的开始。
description.en: An armed insurrection in 1927 led by the Communist Party of China against the Kuomintang, considered the beginning of the CPC's independent leadership of armed struggle and the creation of a revolutionary army.

en: Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在第一次国共内战时期建立和领导的武装力量。
description.en: The armed forces established and led by the Communist Party of China during the First Chinese Civil War.

description.zh-cn: 1927年至1937年间，由中国国民党领导的国民政府与中国共产党领导的地方政权之间的内战。
description.en: The civil war between the Kuomintang-led Nationalist Government and the local regimes led by the Communist Party of China from 1927 to 1937.

description.zh-cn: 20世纪30年代至40年代，中国抵抗日本帝国侵略的全面战争。
description.en: The full-scale war fought by China against the invasion of the Empire of Japan in the 1930s and 1940s.

description.zh-cn: 在抗日战争期间，中国国民党和中国共产党之间为共同对抗日本帝国而达成的合作。
description.en: The alliance between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China during the Second Sino-Japanese War to resist the Japanese invasion.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末至20世纪中叶的日本国家，对中国发动了全面的侵略战争。
description.en: The Japanese nation-state from the late 19th century to the mid-20th century, which launched a full-scale war of aggression against China.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争结束后，中国国民党与中国共产党之间爆发的内战，以中国共产党取得全面胜利告终。
description.en: The civil war between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China after the end of the Second Sino-Japanese War, which resulted in a comprehensive victory for the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 由中国共产党于1949年10月1日在中国大陆建立的社会主义国家。
description.en: A socialist state established in mainland China on October 1, 1949, by the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产主义的先驱，中国共产党的主要创始人之一。
description.en: A pioneer of Chinese communism and one of the main founders of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 共产国际远东局代表，受命前往中国协助建立共产党。
description.en: A representative of the Comintern's Far Eastern Bureau, sent to China to assist in the establishment of the Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 20世纪初中国的一场思想启蒙运动，为共产主义在中国的传播创造了条件。
description.en: An intellectual enlightenment movement in China in the early 20th century, which created conditions for the spread of communism in China.

description.zh-cn: 1917年俄国发生的社会主义革命，对中国共产主义运动的兴起产生了深远影响。
description.en: The socialist revolution that took place in Russia in 1917, which had a profound impact on the rise of the communist movement in China.

description.zh-cn: 新文化运动的主要倡导者之一，中国共产党的主要创始人及早期最高领导人。
description.en: One of the main proponents of the New Culture Movement, a principal founder and early paramount leader of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 在中国成立的第一个共产党早期组织，在各地建党活动中起到了联络中心的作用。
description.en: The first early communist organization established in China, which served as a liaison center for party-building activities in various regions.

description.zh-cn: 共产国际执行委员会委员，曾作为代表指导中国共产党的工作，并提议国共合作。
description.en: A member of the Executive Committee of the Comintern who served as a representative to guide the work of the Communist Party of China and proposed the KMT-CPC cooperation.

nodes.id: 中国共产党第一次全国代表大会

zh-cn: 中国共产党第一次全国代表大会

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党的成立会议，标志着党的正式诞生。
description.en: The founding meeting of the Communist Party of China, marking the official birth of the party.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命的伟大先行者，中国国民党的创始人，中华民国的国父。他确立了联俄容共政策，促成了第一次国共合作。
description.en: A great forerunner of China's modern democratic revolution, founder of the Kuomintang, and the founding father of the Republic of China. He established the policy of alliance with Russia and acceptance of communists, which led to the First United Front.

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党的主要领导人，国民政府的军事和政治领袖。曾任黄埔军校校长，在1927年发起清党，导致第一次国共合作破裂。
description.en: A principal leader of the Kuomintang and the military and political leader of the Nationalist Government. He served as the commandant of the Whampoa Military Academy and initiated the party purge in 1927, leading to the collapse of the First United Front.

description.zh-cn: 1927年由蒋介石在上海发起的政治清洗运动，大规模捕杀共产党员及亲共人士，导致第一次国共合作全面破裂。
description.en: A political purge initiated by Chiang Kai-shek in Shanghai in 1927, involving the large-scale arrest and killing of communists and their sympathizers, which led to the complete breakdown of the First United Front.

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党早期领导人之一，1927年在武汉宣布停止与中国共产党的合作。
description.en: An early leader of the Kuomintang who announced the cessation of cooperation with the Communist Party of China in Wuhan in 1927.

description.zh-cn: 1927年7月15日，汪精卫在武汉宣布停止与中国共产党的合作，标志着第一次国共合作的全面破裂。
description.en: On July 15, 1927, Wang Jingwei announced the cessation of cooperation with the Communist Party of China in Wuhan, marking the complete rupture of the First United Front.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中国人民解放军和中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和领导人。在遵义会议后确立了其在党内的领导地位。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China, the People's Liberation Army, and the People's Republic of China. His leadership within the party was established after the Zunyi Conference.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在第一次国共内战时期建立的政权，被视为中华人民共和国的前身。
description.en: The state established by the Communist Party of China during the First Chinese Civil War, considered the precursor to the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国工农红军主力的一次大规模军事转移，从江西瑞金出发，最终到达陕北。
description.en: A large-scale military retreat by the main forces of the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army, starting from Ruijin, Jiangxi, and ending in northern Shaanxi.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在长征途中召开的一次重要会议，确立了毛泽东在党和红军中的领导地位。
description.en: A crucial meeting held by the Communist Party of China during the Long March, which established Mao Zedong's leadership position in the party and the Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党早期领导人，其“左”倾机会主义路线在遵义会议上受到批判并结束。
description.en: An early leader of the Communist Party of China, whose "left" opportunist line was criticized and terminated at the Zunyi Conference.

description.zh-cn: 张学良和杨虎城在西安发动的“兵谏”，扣押蒋介石，迫使其停止内战、一致抗日，促成了第二次国共合作。
description.en: A "remonstrance by military force" launched by Zhang Xueliang and Yang Hucheng in Xi'an, where Chiang Kai-shek was detained and forced to stop the civil war and unite to resist Japan, leading to the Second United Front.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在延安时期进行的一次全党范围内的马克思主义教育和思想解放运动，巩固了毛泽东的领导地位。
description.en: A party-wide Marxist education and ideological emancipation movement conducted by the CPC during the Yan'an period, which consolidated Mao Zedong's leadership.

description.zh-cn: 由毛泽东发动和领导的政治运动，对中国的政治、社会、文化造成了严重破坏。
description.en: A political movement initiated and led by Mao Zedong, which caused severe damage to China's politics, society, and culture.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第二代中央领导集体的核心，改革开放和中国社会主义现代化建设的总设计师。
description.en: The core of the second generation of central leadership of the Communist Party of China, and the chief architect of China's reform and opening-up and socialist modernization.

description.zh-cn: 曾任中华人民共和国主席，在文化大革命期间被迫害致死。
description.en: Former Chairman of the People's Republic of China, who was persecuted to death during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国元帅，曾被确立为毛泽东的接班人，后因策划政变失败出逃并在蒙古坠机身亡。
description.en: A Marshal of the People's Republic of China, once designated as Mao Zedong's successor. He later died in a plane crash in Mongolia after a failed coup attempt.

description.zh-cn: 指文化大革命后期，由江青、张春桥、姚文元、王洪文组成的政治集团，在毛泽东逝世后被粉碎。
description.en: A political faction composed of Jiang Qing, Zhang Chunqiao, Yao Wenyuan, and Wang Hongwen in the later stages of the Cultural Revolution, which was overthrown after Mao Zedong's death.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东逝世后，华国锋、叶剑英等人采取行动，逮捕“四人帮”及其支持者，标志着文化大革命的结束。
description.en: After Mao Zedong's death, Hua Guofeng, Ye Jianying, and others took action to arrest the "Gang of Four" and their supporters, marking the end of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东逝世后的中国最高领导人，领导了粉碎“四人帮”的行动。
description.en: The paramount leader of China after Mao Zedong's death, who led the action to overthrow the "Gang of Four".

nodes.id: 中国共产党十一届三中全会

zh-cn: 中国共产党十一届三中全会

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党历史上的重要转折点，会议确立了改革开放的路线，将党的工作重心转移到经济建设上。
description.en: A significant turning point in the history of the CPC. The meeting established the line of reform and opening-up and shifted the party's focus to economic construction.

description.zh-cn: 自1978年起在中国大陆推行的以经济改革和对外开放为核心的政策，由邓小平倡导。
description.en: A policy centered on economic reform and opening up to the outside world, implemented in mainland China since 1978 and advocated by Deng Xiaoping.

description.zh-cn: 1989年发生在中国北京的由学生领导的民主运动，最终以武力清场告终。
description.en: A student-led pro-democracy movement in Beijing, China, in 1989, which ended with a military crackdown.

description.zh-cn: 曾任中共中央总书记，因在六四事件中持同情态度而被撤销职务并长期软禁。
description.en: Former General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee, who was removed from office and placed under long-term house arrest for his sympathetic stance during the Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第三代中央领导集体的核心，在六四事件后接任中共中央总书记。
description.en: The core of the third generation of the CPC central leadership, who succeeded as General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee after the Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第四代中央领导集体的核心，提出了科学发展观与和谐社会等思想。
description.en: The core of the fourth generation of the CPC central leadership, who proposed concepts such as the Scientific Outlook on Development and a Harmonious Society.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第五代中央领导集体的核心，现任中共中央总书记。
description.en: The core of the fifth generation of the CPC central leadership, and the current General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在成立初期接受苏联共产党主导的第三国际的指挥和援助，并于1922年正式加入成为其一个支部。
description.en: In its early days, the Communist Party of China accepted the command and aid of the Comintern, which was dominated by the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, and officially joined as a branch in 1922.

description.zh-cn: 第三国际（共产国际）是由苏联共产党主导的国际组织。
description.en: The Third International (Comintern) was an international organization dominated by the Communist Party of the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 在第一次国共合作破裂后，中国共产党与中国国民党决裂，并进行了两次大规模内战。
description.en: After the collapse of the First United Front, the Communist Party of China broke with the Kuomintang and engaged in two large-scale civil wars.

description.zh-cn: 南昌起义被视为中国共产党创建军队的开始，之后中共通过掌握的中国工农红军开展武装斗争。
description.en: The Nanchang Uprising is considered the beginning of the CPC's creation of an army, after which the CPC waged armed struggle through the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 在第二次国共内战中取得胜利后，中国共产党于1949年10月1日宣布成立中华人民共和国。
description.en: After winning the Second Chinese Civil War, the Communist Party of China announced the establishment of the People's Republic of China on October 1, 1949.

description.zh-cn: 1920年，共产国际代表吴廷康（维经斯基）在北京与李大钊会面，商讨在中国组建共产党事宜。
description.en: In 1920, Comintern representative Grigori Voitinsky (Wu Tingkang) met with Li Dazhao in Beijing to discuss the formation of a communist party in China.

description.zh-cn: 1920年，共产国际代表吴廷康（维经斯基）在上海与陈独秀会面，共同商讨建党问题。
description.en: In 1920, Comintern representative Grigori Voitinsky (Wu Tingkang) met with Chen Duxiu in Shanghai to discuss the issue of party building.

description.zh-cn: 1920年8月，陈独秀等人在上海组织成立了中国第一个共产党早期组织，并被推选为书记。
description.en: In August 1920, Chen Duxiu and others organized and established the first early communist organization in China in Shanghai, and he was elected as secretary.

description.zh-cn: 上海共产主义小组是中国第一个共产党早期组织，实际上成为中国各地建党活动的联络中心，为中国共产党的正式成立奠定了基础。
description.en: The Shanghai Communist Group was the first early communist organization in China and effectively served as the liaison center for party-building activities across the country, laying the foundation for the formal establishment of the Communist Party of China.

relationships.source: 中国共产党第一次全国代表大会

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第一次全国代表大会的召开，宣告了中国共产党的正式成立。
description.en: The convening of the First National Congress of the Communist Party of China proclaimed the formal establishment of the party.

description.zh-cn: 共产国际代表马林在与孙中山会谈后，向中共提议应与国民党合作，并得到共产国际的全力支持。
description.en: Comintern representative Maring, after talks with Sun Yat-sen, proposed to the CPC that it should cooperate with the Kuomintang, a proposal that received the full support of the Comintern.

description.zh-cn: 孙中山与苏联代表越飞发表《孙越宣言》，开始实行“联俄容共”策略，为第一次国共合作奠定了基础。
description.en: Sun Yat-sen and Soviet representative Adolph Joffe issued the Sun-Joffe Manifesto, beginning the implementation of the "Alliance with Russia, Acceptance of Communists" policy, which laid the foundation for the First United Front.

description.zh-cn: 根据中共三大的决议，全体共产党员以个人名义加入中国国民党，实现“党内合作”。
description.en: According to the resolution of the 3rd CPC National Congress, all Communist Party members joined the Kuomintang as individuals to achieve "inner-party cooperation".

description.zh-cn: 1927年4月12日，蒋介石在上海发起“清党”，大规模捕杀共产党员。
description.en: On April 12, 1927, Chiang Kai-shek initiated the "Party Purification" in Shanghai, carrying out a large-scale purge of communists.

description.zh-cn: 蒋介石发起的清党运动导致国共关系破裂。
description.en: The Party Purification movement initiated by Chiang Kai-shek led to the rupture of KMT-CPC relations.

description.zh-cn: 1927年7月15日，汪精卫在武汉宣布停止与中国共产党的合作，标志着第一次国共合作全面破裂。
description.en: On July 15, 1927, Wang Jingwei announced the cessation of cooperation with the Communist Party of China in Wuhan, marking the complete rupture of the First United Front.

description.zh-cn: 1931年11月7日，中国共产党在苏联支援下于江西瑞金成立中华苏维埃共和国。
description.en: On November 7, 1931, the Communist Party of China, with the support of the Soviet Union, established the Chinese Soviet Republic in Ruijin, Jiangxi.

description.zh-cn: 遵义会议确立了毛泽东在党和红军中的领导地位，恢复了他对红军的指挥权。
description.en: The Zunyi Conference established Mao Zedong's leadership position in the party and the Red Army, restoring his command over the Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 遵义会议结束了以王明为代表的“左”倾机会主义路线在党中央的统治。
description.en: The Zunyi Conference ended the dominance of the "left" opportunist line represented by Wang Ming in the party's Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 西安事变迫使蒋介石接受“停止剿共、一同抗日”的主张，促成了抗日民族统一战线的建立。
description.en: The Xi'an Incident forced Chiang Kai-shek to accept the proposal to "stop suppressing the Communists and unite to resist Japan," which facilitated the establishment of the Anti-Japanese National United Front.

description.zh-cn: 通过延安整风运动，毛泽东在中国共产党党内的领导地位获得确立，全党达到了空前的团结。
description.en: Through the Yan'an Rectification Movement, Mao Zedong's leadership position within the Communist Party of China was established, and the entire party achieved unprecedented unity.

description.zh-cn: 延安整风运动打击了中共党内以王明为首的国际派（教条主义），使其在党内失去势力。
description.en: The Yan'an Rectification Movement targeted the internationalist faction (dogmatists) within the CPC, led by Wang Ming, causing them to lose their influence within the party.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命期间，时任国家主席刘少奇被革除党内外一切职务并被迫害致死。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, then-Chairman Liu Shaoqi was stripped of all his positions inside and outside the party and was persecuted to death.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平在文化大革命初期被革除党和国家的职务。
description.en: Deng Xiaoping was removed from his party and state posts in the early stages of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 华国锋、叶剑英等人通过怀仁堂事变，逮捕了“四人帮”成员，结束了他们的政治生涯。
description.en: Hua Guofeng, Ye Jianying, and others arrested the members of the "Gang of Four" in the Huirentang Incident, ending their political careers.

description.zh-cn: 粉碎“四人帮”标志着持续十年的文化大革命的结束。
description.en: The overthrow of the "Gang of Four" marked the end of the ten-year-long Cultural Revolution.

relationships.source: 中国共产党十一届三中全会

description.zh-cn: 中共十一届三中全会是一个重要的转折点，会议确立了改革开放的路线，并将党的工作重心转移到现代化建设上。
description.en: The Third Plenary Session of the 11th CPC Central Committee was a significant turning point; it established the policy of reform and opening-up and shifted the party's focus to modernization.

description.zh-cn: 六四事件后，时任中共中央总书记赵紫阳被撤销职务并长期处于软禁状态。
description.en: After the Tiananmen Square incident, then-General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee Zhao Ziyang was removed from his post and placed under long-term house arrest.

description.zh-cn: 六四事件后，时任上海市委书记的江泽民被选为中共中央总书记，成为第三代领导集体的核心。
description.en: After the Tiananmen Square incident, Jiang Zemin, then Party Secretary of Shanghai, was elected as the General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee, becoming the core of the third generation of leadership.
